TestCase.TestCaseObjective: Let's use the terms 'BSO-v1' and 'BSO-v2', indicating a major version update to the BSO as an example. Assess what happens when the Provider supports BSO-v1 whereas the Consumer supports BSO-v2, the Consumer requests instances of BSO-v2 and the Provider responds with instances of BSO-v1 notification.
TestCase.TestCaseScenario: A 'major version update' refers to a change in a message schema that is sufficiently significant to warrant a new namespace (i.e. a new schema), not just an extension.
TestCase.TestCaseEnvironment: Internet or Co-located. Exchange Pattern: R/R.
TestCase.TestCaseInput: Current situation as known by the provider.
TestCase.TestCaseConclusion: The test is completed when the consumer system (v2) has tried to receive the current situation from the provider (v1) by means of the MIP4.0 Request-Response exchange pattern.
TestCase.TestCaseOutput: Assess (record) what happens when the Provider supports BSO-v1 whereas the Consumer supports BSO-v2. Is the backwards version compatibility kept in case of new namespace (i.e. a new schema)?

TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepAction: Consumer (2, supports BSO-v2) requests current situation from Provider (1, supports BSO-v1).
TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepResult: Provider receives request (for BSO-v2 instances). Record Provider behaviour, regarding backwards version compatibility.

TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepAction: Provider (1, supports BSO-v1) responds to Consumer's (2, supports BSO-v2) request.
TestCaseStep.TestCaseStepResult: Received response at Consumer: either current situation data (BSO-v1 instances) or an error / problem notification. Record Consumer and Provider behaviour, regarding backwards version compatibility.
